class="ad-container"></div></div><div id="piano-newsletter-container"></div><header class="content-header standard-header">			<div class="content-header-inner">		<h1 class="content-hed standard-hed" id="adn3nc97c">The President Is Accusing People of 'TREASON!' on Twitter. It's Just Another Morning in America.</h1>					<h2 class="content-dek standard-dek"><p class="">The president conveniently went ballistic with the "spying" stuff after we learned about the Flynn tape.</p></h2>				<div class="content-info standard-info">	<div class="content-info-metadata">											<div class="byline-with-image">		<div class="content-info-byline-image">												<img style="height: 40px; width: 40px; background: #000">						</div>				<!-- shared/byline -->				<div class="byline ">By					<a class="byline-name" href="/author/13895/jack-holmes/" data-vars-ga-ux-element="Byline" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="Jack Holmes"><span class="byline-name" id="rxjapvaku">Jack Holmes</span></a>			</div><!-- / shared/byline -->	</div>								<time class="content-info-date" datetime="2019-05-17T15:36:56.438792Z" id="vwzehhppu">											May 17, 2019					</time>	</div>	</div>	</div></header><div id="piano-content-container"></div><div class="content-container standard-container">		<div class="standard-body">										<div class="content-lede-image standard-lede-image">				<div class="content-lede-image-wrap aspect-ratio-1x1">								<img style="height: 736.906px; width: 739.188px; background: #000"><div class="image-credit content-lede-image-credit">			<span class="image-photo-credit">The Washington Post</span><span class="image-copyright">Getty Images</span>		</div>						</div>									</div>						<div class="article-body-content standard-body-content">			<p class="body-dropcap">Every day the President of the United States wakes up and binges on television, rage tweets about what he sees, and hopes the <em>Fox & Friends </em>geniuses will put his tweets up on the screen so he can see himself on the teevee. We have accepted this as a fact of life: <a class="body-link" href="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/a26361851/trump-national-emergency-press-conference-wall/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/a26361851/trump-national-emergency-press-conference-wall/">the president is a Fox News Grandpa</a> trapped in a symbiosis of stupid with a right-wing cable network that is continually melting his brain. Sometimes, if there's a big story in the news that he doesn't want people to talk about anymore, the President of the United States will accuse some people of <em>TREASON</em>. We have accepted this also.</p><p class="body-text">For proof of concept, we can examine the Presidential Feed on this fine Friday. Having recorded <a class="body-link" href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129147418682040320" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129147418682040320">a blast-from-the-past roast video</a> about newly minted presidential candidate Bill de Blasio the night previous, the world's most powerful man awoke this morning and proceeded to rattle off Official Messages From the President about: <a class="body-link" href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129334905228468224" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129334905228468224">the National Emergency at the border</a> (remember that?), <a class="body-link" href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129336982319050752" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129336982319050752">"bad hombres,"</a> how people he's giddy to deport <a class="body-link" href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129338665216430080" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129338665216430080">shouldn't "get comfortable,"</a> a quick muse about <a class="body-link" href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129339132373884928" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129339132373884928">whether Democrats will give "our Country" an immigration win</a>, a <em>Fox & Friends </em>quote <a class="body-link" href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129340465835388929" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129340465835388929">featuring</a> "down goes Comey," and all-caps renditions of his genius-brain slogans. DRAIN THE SWAMP! says the man presiding over <a class="body-link" href="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/a25989196/donald-trump-cabinet-members-2019-list/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/a25989196/donald-trump-cabinet-members-2019-list/">The Great American Heist</a>.</p><p class="body-text">But then it really began.</p><p class="body-text">"New Fox Poll: 58% of people say that the FBI broke the law in investigating Donald J. Trump. <a class="body-link" href="https://twitter.com/foxandfriends" dir="ltr" data-mentioned-user-id="15513604" data-scribe="element:mention" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://twitter.com/foxandfriends">@foxandfriends</a>," the president tweeted, followed minutes later by: "My Campaign for President was conclusively spied on. Nothing like this has ever happened in American Politics. A really bad situation. TREASON means long jail sentences, and this was TREASON!"</p><div class="embed embed-twitter embed-center media-loader lazyload" data-align="center">	<div class="embed-inner">					<blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p class="body-text">New Fox Poll: 58% of people say that the FBI broke the law in investigating Donald J. Trump. <a class="body-link" href="https://twitter.com/foxandfriends?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://twitter.com/foxandfriends?ref_src=twsrc^tfw">@foxandfriends</a></p>— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) <a class="body-link" href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129342171612626944?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129342171612626944?ref_src=twsrc^tfw">May 17, 2019</a></blockquote>			</div></div><div class="embed embed-twitter embed-center media-loader lazyload" data-align="center">	<div class="embed-inner">					<blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p class="body-text">My Campaign for President was conclusively spied on. Nothing like this has ever happened in American Politics. A really bad situation. TREASON means long jail sentences, and this was TREASON!</p>— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) <a class="body-link" href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129343742748569601?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129343742748569601?ref_src=twsrc^tfw">May 17, 2019</a></blockquote>			</div></div><p class="body-text">So here you can see the president repeating a Fox News poll stat indicating more than half of the public thinks the FBI broke the law while investigating him and then, almost instantaneously, converting this into a definitive judgment before God and man: his campaign was <em>CONCLUSIVELY</em> spied on. <em>Many people are saying it</em>, which is the same thing as it being true. In conclusion, it was treason. <em>TREASON!</em><em></em> Throw them in jail!</p><p class="body-text">Suddenly the "down goes Comey" line has a new resonance. After all, the President of the United States is now calling for those who led a perfectly legitimate investigation into him and his associates—one which found <a class="body-link" href="https://www.vox.com/2018/6/11/17438386/trump-russia-collusion" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.vox.com/2018/6/11/17438386/trump-russia-collusion">they certainly did know of and encourage Russia's meddling in the election for Trump's benefit</a>, even if it did not rise to criminal conspiracy—to be thrown in jail as traitors to the republic. This falls right in line with <a class="body-link" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/20/us/politics/president-trump-justice-department.html" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/20/us/politics/president-trump-justice-department.html">his demands that his political opponents be investigated and jailed</a>. This is a particular concern because he now as a pet toad for an attorney general <a class="body-link" href="https://twitter.com/joshtpm/status/1129373456058003458" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://twitter.com/joshtpm/status/1129373456058003458">who is exclusively doing interviews on his propaganda network</a>, spreading the "spying" meme. (This is after William Barr <a class="body-link" href="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/a27335990/kamala-harris-william-barr-obstruction-of-justice-mueller-report/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/a27335990/kamala-harris-william-barr-obstruction-of-justice-mueller-report/">sabotaged the public rollout of The Mueller Report</a> to downplay that <a class="body-link" href="https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2019/04/ben-wittes-five-conclusions-mueller-report/588259/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2019/04/ben-wittes-five-conclusions-mueller-report/588259/">it clearly lays out multiple felonies the president committed</a>, and was meant <a class="body-link" href="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/politics/a27198446/mueller-report-congress-impeachment/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/politics/a27198446/mueller-report-congress-impeachment/">to serve as a referral to Congress</a> to initiate impeachment proceedings.) The Justice Department is now a political weapon.</p><p class="body-text"></p><div class="embed embed-image embed-image-right embed-image-large" data-align="right" data-size="large">	<div class="embed-inner crop-1x1">	<div class="embed-image-wrap aspect-ratio-1x1">																<span class="lqip lazyload" data-expand="2000" data-lqip="https://hips.hearstapps.com/hmg-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/images/trumpbarr-1558105892.jpg?crop=0.619xw:0.929xh;0.0221xw,0&resize=480:*&frame=1&lqip=yes"></span>		<picture class="zoomable lazyload lazyimage" style="touch-action: auto; -webkit-user-drag: auto;"><img style="height: 30px; width: 358.391px; background: #000"></picture></div>		</div>	<div class="embed-image-info">		<figcaption>Trump and his pet toad pose a severe threat to our independent system of justice.</figcaption><div class="image-credit embed-image-credit">			<span class="image-copyright">Getty Images</span>		</div>		</div></div> <p class="body-text"></p><p class="body-text">It's also right in line with his (and his lawyers') new position <a class="body-link" href="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/politics/a27471341/donald-trump-lawyers-congress-subpoena-law-enforcement-watergate/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/politics/a27471341/donald-trump-lawyers-congress-subpoena-law-enforcement-watergate/">that Congress has no right to investigate the president</a>—the Constitution and its separation of powers be damned. This position is tantamount to saying the president is above the law and there can be no check on his power. <a class="body-link" href="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/politics/a27471341/donald-trump-lawyers-congress-subpoena-law-enforcement-watergate/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/politics/a27471341/donald-trump-lawyers-congress-subpoena-law-enforcement-watergate/">They said Watergate was an illegitimate investigation!</a> "When the president does it, it's not illegal." It's also right in line with his relentless assault on the free press, another institution of democracy capable of holding him accountable, which continued this Friday morning with <a class="body-link" href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129382204990214144" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1129382204990214144">a tweet about Iran</a> that was not as reassuring as he might have believed when writing it.</p><div class="embed embed-editorial-links embed-left" data-align="left">	<div class="editorial-links-header">		Related Stories	</div>	<div class="embed-inner editorial-links-inner">												<a class="editorial-link-item" href="/news-politics/politics/a27505069/michael-flynn-tape-donald-trump-lawyer-obstruction/" data-vars-ga-ux-element="Editorial Links" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/politics/a27505069/michael-flynn-tape-donald-trump-lawyer-obstruction/" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="It Makes a Difference If There Are Tapes" data-vars-ga-position="1" data-vars-ga-total-positions="2">					<div class="editorial-link-item-image">											<img style="height: 60.0781px; width: 120.156px; background: #000"></div>					<div class="editorial-link-item-title">It Makes a Difference If There Are Tapes</div>				</a>															<a class="editorial-link-item" href="/news-politics/politics/a27482016/william-barr-whitewater-bill-clinton-george-hw-bush-donald-trump/" data-vars-ga-ux-element="Editorial Links" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/politics/a27482016/william-barr-whitewater-bill-clinton-george-hw-bush-donald-trump/" data-vars-ga-call-to-action="William Barr Never Had Integrity. Here's Proof." data-vars-ga-position="2" data-vars-ga-total-positions="2">					<div class="editorial-link-item-image">											<img style="height: 60.0781px; width: 120.156px; background: #000"></div>					<div class="editorial-link-item-title">William Barr Never Had Integrity. Here's Proof.</div>				</a>						</div></div><p class="body-text">Of course, ramping up the Spy talk might have something to do with last night's revelation that <a class="body-link" href="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/politics/a27505069/michael-flynn-tape-donald-trump-lawyer-obstruction/" target="_blank" data-vars-ga-outbound-link="https://www.esquire.com/news-politics/politics/a27505069/michael-flynn-tape-donald-trump-lawyer-obstruction/">there is a voicemail tape</a> of one of Trump's lawyers trying to <em>influence</em> onetime National Security Adviser Michael Flynn, part of what was apparently a pattern of attempts to prevent Flynn from cooperating with the investigation or to limit that cooperation. We shouldn't need the tape to acknowledge the obvious: the president broke the law repeatedly. But more than that, he is an aspiring autocrat who will destroy the pillars of our republic—the Constitution's separation of powers, an independent system of justice, a free press—to avoid the consequences of what he's done. It's not complicated. He must be removed before he can do so.</p>																	<div class="authors ">																	<div class="author" itemprop="author" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><a
